posts.name: 29 Diner
posts.note: Old-school 1940s-era diner serving up comfort food faves like cheeseburgers and fountain sodas. Great breakfast place.

posts.name: America Eats Tavern
posts.note: Chef Jose Andres riffs on classics from America's culinary heritage in a homey, art-filled setting. You need to go with a few people so you can try most of the menu. If you like ham get the five ham sampler plate.

posts.name: Bangkok Golden
posts.note: No-frills spot for Thai and Laotian dishes that also offers lunch and dinner buffets.

posts.name: Banh Mi DC Sandwich
posts.note: Vietnamese market has a variety of banh mi sandwiches and other snacks, plus a handful of tables.

posts.name: Blue and White Carry Out
posts.note: The Blue and White Carry Out only shack where you can get an egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on toasted white bread for under $2 or a pork chop sandwich for about $3.50.

posts.name: Bob and Edith's
posts.note: Old-school diner serving American comfort food 24/7 to everyone from hipsters to families.

posts.name: Boccato Gelato and Espresso
posts.note: Occasional live music plays at this coffee shop with an espresso bar, gelato and other desserts.

posts.name: Bombay Curry
posts.note: Casual Indian eatery with traditional dishes such as curries and kebabs, plus a Sunday lunch buffet.

posts.name: Caphe Banh Mi
posts.note: Casual Vietnamese eatery cooking up classics like pho noodle soups and banh mi sandwiches.

posts.name: Cerritos Pupuseria
posts.note: You need to order the chicken tamales and any of the pupusa's.

posts.name: Creekside Bakery and Deli
posts.note: They have wonderful pastries and donuts. My favorites are the blackberry and blueberry turnovers, aong with their glazed yeast leaven donuts.

posts.name: Dairy Godmother
posts.note: NOTE - Temporarily Closed. Retro-style parlor dishing up unusual flavors of homemade frozen custard and sorbet.

posts.name: District Taco
posts.note: In 2009, two neighbors got together over some homemade chips, salsa and guacamole and decided to launch District Taco as a food truck.

posts.name: Earl's Sandwiches
posts.note: Creative sandwich shop featuring meats slow-roasted in house, with some veggie offerings too.

posts.name: Four Sisters Restaurant
posts.note: We look forward to sharing with you our delightful, savory and distinctive home-style dishes reminiscent of our native country â€” all served with the charm and hospitality of the Four Sisters family. Great Vietnamese cuisine.

posts.name: Green Fare Organic Cafe *
posts.note: GreenFare offers delicious organic, whole plant food lovingly prepared oil free and with no added salt for those seeking a refuge from the ordinary. I had their black bean burger at TEDxMidAtlantic after party and oyu need to give it a try.

posts.name: Hank's Pasta Bar *
posts.note: Pasta samplers and trendy cocktails are big draws at this rustic-chic Italian with a classy lounge.

posts.name: Haute Dogs and Fries
posts.note: Gourmet hot dogs with housemade onion relish and locally sourced sausages in a modern, brick space.

posts.name: Jack's Place
posts.note: Pint-size nook that lures locals for straightforward hot & cold sandwiches plus breakfast bites.

posts.name: The Java Shack
posts.note: Neighborhood coffee shop featuring hot and cold brews made with locally roasted beans and a patio.

posts.name: Knotty Pine Restaurant
posts.note: Longtime local haunt offering classic American grub, including breakfast, plus a back bar area.

posts.name: Metro 29 Diner
posts.note: Spacious diner with varied American menu (known for its French toast), open from early till late.

posts.name: Momo Sushi
posts.note: Sushi bar and kitchen with fresh rolls, teriyaki and noodles, plus lots of wine, sake and Japanese beers.

posts.name: Peter Chang
posts.note: Cult chef Peter Chang serves his Sichuan playbook and special dishes at this spiffed-up storefront.

posts.name: Pho 75
posts.note: Traditional pho with a wide choice of add-ons served in a modest setting. Cash only.

posts.name: Pho  Viet Flare
posts.note: Unassuming strip-mall restaurant ladling out bowls of pho and other Vietnamese staples.

posts.name: Punjabi by Nature
posts.note: True to its name, Punjabi By Nature has created a wonderful and authentic aroma of high quality indian cuisine, bringing its best from the capital of India(Delhi) to the heart of Virginia in Lansdowne.

posts.name: Ravi Kabob House *
posts.note: No-frills restaurant offering kebabs and other Pakistani staples at super-cheap prices.

posts.name: Ray's Hell Burger
posts.note: Unassuming spot for hamburgers with gourmet add-ons, steak & cheese sandwiches, boozy shakes and more.

posts.name: Ray's the Steaks
posts.note: Steaks served with family-style sides of mashed potatoes and creamed spinach in a minimalist space.

posts.name: Souvlaki Bar
posts.note: Souvlaki Bar, they bring authentic traditional recipes for you to enjoy the delicious Greek flavors of fresh-tasting combinations of lemon juice, garlic, oregano, sea salt and olive oil. You need to try the chicken Souvlaki and the pork Yeero along with a side of Greek roasted potatoes.

posts.name: Sugar Shack Donuts
posts.note: This offshoot of the Richmond original specializes in handmade donuts with unique glazes and toppings.

posts.name: Sweet Fire Donna's *
posts.note: This relaxed joint offers traditional smoked barbecue with familiar sides, plus a full bar. he sandwich to get is the 'Bubba Mike' an oversized sandwich with 1/2 lb. of pulled pork and a Texas sausage link, topped with cheese sauce, creamy coleslaw, and original BBQ sauce.

posts.name: Taco Bamba
posts.note: Colorful, counter-serve storefront dishing up Mexican eats for takeout or quick stand-up dining.

posts.name: Taqueria el Poblano
posts.note: Family-friendly dining featuring south-of-the-border favorites and made-from-scratch margaritas.

posts.name: Taqueria Mexicana
posts.note: You can get authentic Mexican tacos with contents like lengua (tongue), tripe, pork, beef, chicken, tortas, and many other things.

posts.name: Vaso's Kitchen
posts.note: Homey neighborhood staple with a cozy dining room and patio seating serving Greek comfort food. You need to order Artichoke Florentina for an appetizer and the Lamb Shank for dinner.
